GeneralInformation.School Vision: A Leader in Every Child - with Talents and Strength of Character
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Nurturing leaders through a distinctive education in learning and character development.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: We believe that "Every child matters and every child can succeed". Since its founding in 1977, Henry Park Primary School has been educating responsible citizens and citizen-leaders for our society. Much emphasis is placed on the two key pillars that support both academic excellence and character development to ensure the holistic development of talented all-rounders. We provide a distinctively unique learning experience to meet the varied needs and interests of all our students. Supported by a team of skilful and dedicated staff who take pride in their service, the school seeks to identify the strengths of each individual student and develop his or her potential to the fullest, be it the cognitive, aesthetic, leadership or physical domain. With its value-added academic programmes, coupled with a strong focus on character education, students are developed to be resilient, upright and responsible leaders, possessing a strong sense of identity and a desire to contribute to society. It is the school's fervent belief that every Henry Park student that passes through its doors will be engaged learners imbued with 21CC skills to face the challenges of the future.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: 1. The "Character Education Programme" seeks to imbue strong values in our students and develop in them a deep sense of belonging and rootedness to Singapore. Students learn about empathy and care for the environment and fellow citizens through VIA projects. 2. The "Applied Learning Programme" enables students to apply scientific skills and concepts in real-life situation through inquiry, while the IvP provides a unique opportunity for them to develop their problem-solving & inventive skills. 3. "Sports4Life@HPPS" aims to build character and instil values through sports and outdoor education. Another key feature of the LLP is the Sports Leaders Development Programme, which focuses on developing students in the physical and leadership domains. There is also a modular Gymnastics Programme for P1 and 2 students to develop their motor skills, and build flexibility, agility and strength - fundamental to the development of advanced motor skills. 4. In the "Literature Programme", students are taught how to be sensitive and empathetic towards others alongside with the appreciation and analysis of good language use. 5. The "Programme for Active Learning" exposes the lower primary students to varied & fun learning experiences in four domains - Sports & Games, Outdoor Education, Performing and Visual Arts - to nurture their socio-emotional competencies, curiosity, co-operative skills and confidence. 6. To prepare our students to have a global outlook, the school partners The Japanese School to arrange student and teacher exchanges as well as Homestay Programme for P5 students.
